contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|watcher|watchers}} '''Watcher''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==In print== * [[Watcher (comics)]], an extraterrestrial species who watches the universe in Marvel Comics ** [[Uatu]], the Watcher * [[The Watcher (1851 novel)|''The Watcher'' (1851 novel)]], an 1851 novel written by Sheridan Le Fanu * [[The Watcher (1981 novel)|''The Watcher'' (1981 novel)]], a 1981 novel written by Kay Nolte Smith * [[Watchers (novel)|''Watchers'' (novel)]], a 1987 novel written by Dean Koontz * [[Watcher in the Water]], a creature from J. R. R. Tolkien's fantasy book series ''The Lord of the Rings'' * The [[Watcher (angel)]] or [[Grigori]], a class of fallen angels in Biblical apocrypha ==In television, film and radio== * [[The Watcher (TV series)|''The Watcher'' (TV series)]], a 1995 UPN TV series starring Sir Mix-a-Lot * [[The Watcher (film)|''The Watcher'' (film)]], a 2000 film directed by Joe Charbanic <!--* [[Watchers (radio)|"Watchers" (radio)]], a 2001 adaptation of [[H. G. Wells]]' story ''The Crystal Egg'', produced by the ''Radio Tales'' series for ''NPR''--> * [[Watcher (Buffy the Vampire Slayer)]], a member of the Watcher's Council in the ''Buffy'' and ''Angel'' television series * [[Watcher (Highlander)]], a secret organization that watches the Immortals in the Highlander series * [[Watchers (film)|''Watchers'' (film)]], a 1988 film directed by Jon Hess based on the novel by Koontz * "The Watcher", first episode of the 1965 ''Doctor Who'' serial ''[[The Time Meddler#Doctor Who episode head|The Time Meddler]]'' * [[Watcher (Doctor Who)]], a character in the 1981 ''Logopolis'' serial of the television series ''Doctor Who'' * [[The Watchers (TV series)]], an announced [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] supernatural drama, by [[Nicholas Sparks]] ==In music== * "The Watcher", a song by [[Enslaved (band)|Enslaved]] from their 2008 album ''[[Vertebrae (album)|Vertebrae]]'' * "The Watcher", a song by [[Hawkwind]] from their 1972 album ''[[Doremi Fasol Latido]]'' * "[[The Watcher (Dr. Dre song)]]", a song by Dr. Dre on his 1999 album ''The Chronic 2001'' * "The Watcher 2", a song by [[Jay-Z]] featuring Dr. Dre, Truth Hurts and Rakim * "The Watcher of the Skies", a song by [[Genesis (band)|Genesis]] on their 1972 album ''[[Foxtrot]]'' ==Other== * [[Watcher (presence)]], a subscriber for presence information * Bahl'al, one of the six Fallen Lords of the computer game series ''[[Myth (series)|Myth]]'' (also identified as the "Mad Goat of the Fens") *In the video game, [[Dark Void]] the Watchers appear as [[reptilians]] or the [[Annunaki]] {{disambig}}
